page.title: 02Buckhead Opencast Mine.1.
page.content: Work at the opencast started at the end of 1979,after public meetings and amid much complaint from local people. By digging 1400 bore holes the site engineers and geologists knew that they would be able to take coal, profitably, from an area of some 400 hectares, covering 16 coal seams. Seventy men are employed on the site, but although it is an N.C.B. project each process is contracted to other firms, under the direction of the N.C.B. site engineer and his deputy. Visitors to the site must be impressed by the caring attitude, held by the engineers, for the local environment.They have been most careful to avoid any pollution of nearby streams by storing waste liquid in deep lagoons, and they have established good relationships with local people.
